storyContent.tagHTML: In the city of Vänijya, there lived a very wealthy and respected householder named Änand. He was rich in gold, cash, and cattle. After listening to a sermon by Bhagawän Mahävir, he became a devout follower, accepting the twelve vows of a householder (Shrävak). For fourteen years, he observed these vows and progressed spiritually.

Avadhi-jnän (clairvoyance). Mahävir's chief disciple, Gautam-swämi, heard of this and went to visit him. Änand respectfully told his guru, “I have attained Avadhi-jnän, with which I can see as high as the first heaven and as low as the first hell.”

Gautam-swämi, believing such a powerful vision was impossible for a layman, told Änand he must be mistaken and needed to atone for his claim. Puzzled, Änand asked if one must repent for speaking the truth. This left Gautam-swämi equally puzzled, so he went to Mahävir to confirm.

Bhagawän Mahävir confirmed, “Gautam, Änand was telling the truth. Rarely does a layperson attain such power... You should repent for your mistake.” Without hesitation, Gautam-swämi set aside his alms, returned to Änand, and asked for forgiveness for doubting him. This act demonstrated the core Jain principles that truth is paramount and that even a great guru must humbly ask forgiveness from a disciple if he is in the wrong. Änand later fasted until death and was reborn in heaven, destined for eventual liberation.

events.title: Accepting the Vows
events.description: After hearing Mahävir's sermon, the wealthy householder Änand accepts the 12 vows of a Shrävak.

events.title: Spiritual Attainment
events.description: Through years of penance and meditation, he attains a powerful form of Avadhi-jnän (clairvoyance).

events.title: A Visit from Gautam-swämi
events.description: Gautam-swämi hears of Änand's attainment and goes to visit him.

events.title: A Doubtful Guru
events.description: Gautam-swämi doubts that a layman could have such a powerful vision and tells Änand to repent for his claim.

events.title: Confirmation from the Master
events.description: Gautam-swämi consults Mahävir, who confirms Änand was telling the truth and instructs Gautam-swämi to repent instead.

events.title: A Humble Apology
events.description: Without hesitation, Gautam-swämi returns to Änand and asks for his forgiveness, demonstrating true humility.

events.title: Path to Liberation
events.description: Later in life, Änand fasts until death, is reborn as a heavenly being, and is destined for eventual liberation.

charactersData.name: Änand Shrävak
charactersData.description: A wealthy and devout householder who, through intense spiritual practice, attained a rare and powerful form of clairvoyance (Avadhi-jnän). His story illustrates that great spiritual heights can be reached even by laypeople.

charactersData.name: Gautam-swämi
charactersData.description: The chief disciple of Mahävir. His interaction with Änand demonstrates the Jain principle of humility, as he did not hesitate to ask forgiveness from a disciple upon realizing his own error.

charactersData.name: Bhagawän Mahävir
charactersData.description: The 24th Tirthankar, who served as the ultimate arbiter of truth. He confirmed Änand's ability and corrected his own chief disciple, showing impartiality and adherence to truth above all.

quizData.question: What was Änand's status in society?
quizData.answer: He was a very rich householder (Shrävak).

quizData.question: For how many years did Änand observe the twelve vows of a householder?
What special ability did Änand attain through his penance?
What did Änand claim he could see with his Avadhi-jnän?
quizData.answer: As high as the first heaven and as low as the first hell.

quizData.question: Who was the chief disciple of Mahävir who visited Änand?
How did Gautam-swämi initially react to Änand's claim?
quizData.answer: He did not believe a layman could have such a powerful ability and told him to repent.

quizData.question: What was Änand's polite but firm question back to Gautam-swämi?
quizData.answer: “Does one need to repent for speaking the truth?”

quizData.question: Who did Gautam-swämi consult to confirm the truth?
What did Mahävir tell Gautam-swämi?
quizData.answer: That Änand was telling the truth and that Gautam-swämi should be the one to repent for his mistake.

quizData.question: What did Gautam-swämi do immediately after hearing this?
quizData.answer: He set aside his alms, returned to Änand, and asked for his forgiveness.

quizData.question: What important principle does Gautam-swämi's action demonstrate?
quizData.answer: That a guru should humbly ask for forgiveness from a disciple if the guru has made a mistake.

quizData.question: What happened to Änand at the end of his life?
quizData.answer: He fasted until death and was reborn as a heavenly being.

quizData.question: What is Änand's ultimate destiny after his heavenly life?
quizData.answer: He will be reborn as a human and attain liberation.

children.name: Doubts the extent of his power

graphicsData.title: The Rich Householder
graphicsData.description: Änand, a man of immense wealth, listens to Bhagawän Mahävir's sermon and decides to dedicate his life to the 12 vows of a Jain layman.
graphicsData.imageAlt: A wealthy man sitting respectfully and listening to a sermon by a monk.

graphicsData.title: A Powerful Vision
graphicsData.description: Through his years of penance, Änand attains Avadhi-jnän, the power of clairvoyance, allowing his consciousness to see into the heavens and hells.
graphicsData.imageAlt: A man meditating, with images of heavens above him and hells below him.

graphicsData.title: A Guru's Doubt
graphicsData.description: When Änand describes his powerful vision, his own guru, the great Gautam-swämi, finds it hard to believe and tells him he must be mistaken.
graphicsData.imageAlt: An elder monk looking skeptically at a devout layman.

graphicsData.title: Seeking the Truth
graphicsData.description: Puzzled, Gautam-swämi approaches the omniscient Bhagawän Mahävir to ask for clarification about Änand's claim.
graphicsData.imageAlt: Gautam-swämi asking a question to Bhagawän Mahävir.

graphicsData.title: A Humble Apology
graphicsData.description: Upon learning from Mahävir that Änand was correct, Gautam-swämi immediately returns and asks for his disciple's forgiveness, demonstrating incredible humility.
graphicsData.imageAlt: An elder monk bowing respectfully to his own disciple.

graphicsData.title: Destined for Liberation
graphicsData.description: Having lived a life of truth and devotion, Änand Shrävak is reborn into a heavenly realm, with his ultimate destiny being liberation.
graphicsData.imageAlt: A soul ascending towards a shining, peaceful realm.
